Docs.summary: Represents a collection of parameters relevant to an and their respective mappings to columns in a . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The number of parameters in the collection must equal the number of parameter placeholders within the command text, or else the .NET Framework Data Provider for ODBC raises an error.
## Examples The following example assumes that the data source has a table named **MoneyTable** and a stored procedure named **MoneyProcedure**, which are defined as follows:
``` CREATE TABLE MoneyTable (col1 int, col2 smallmoney, col3 decimal);
CREATE PROC MoneyProcedure (@p1 int, @p2 smallmoney, @p3 decimal) AS INSERT INTO MyTable VALUES (@p1, @p2, @p3);
```
The example creates parameters and calls the **MoneyProcedure** stored procedure.
[!code-csharp[Classic WebData OdbcParameter.DbType#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData OdbcParameter.DbType/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData OdbcParameter.DbType#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData OdbcParameter.DbType/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use caution when using this overload of the <xref:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcParameterCollection.Add%2A> method to specify integer parameter values. Because this overload takes a `value` of type <xref:System.Object>, you must convert the integer value to an <xref:System.Object> type when the value is zero, as the following C# example demonstrates.
``` parameters.Add("@pname", Convert.ToInt32(0)); ```
If you do not perform this conversion, the compiler will assume you are attempting to call the <xref:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcParameterCollection.Add%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> overload.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example searches for an <xref:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcParameter> with a given <xref:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcParameter.ParameterName%2A> within an <xref:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcParameterCollection>. If the parameter exists, the example displays the name and index of the parameter. If the parameter does not exist, the example displays an error. This example assumes that an <xref:System.Data.Odbc.OdbcParameterCollection> has already been created.
